channel.title: International: Top News And Analysis
channel.description: CNBC International is the world leader for news on business, technology, China, trade, oil prices, the Middle East and markets.

item.title: Auto giants endured a torrid time of it this year — and few expect 2025 to be much better
item.description: A perfect storm of challenges for the European automobile industry shows no sign of letting up, analysts say.

item.title: China's monetary shift signals economic worries, but 'bazooka-style' stimulus is unlikely, experts say
item.description: Despite a flurry of stimulus measures, recent economic indicators have showed the world's second-largest economy is still struggling with deflationary pressures.

item.title: Greece's ghost towns offer a glimpse of a country struggling with 'existential' population collapse
item.description: Years of declining births, economic hardship and mass emigration have left huge swathes of Greece vacant, creating fresh concerns for the country.

item.title: Alphabet shares jump 6% after Google touts 'breakthrough' quantum chip
item.description: Google shares rose on Tuesday after the company's unveiling of "Willow," its latest quantum computing chip.

item.title: CNBC Daily Open: Can quantum computing be used in the real world?
item.description: Quantum computing is promising, but can it be used in anything?

item.title: China ramps up Wall Street meetings as Trump inauguration looms
item.description: Chinese Vice Premier He Lifeng has met with several U.S. finance executives as Beijing seeks to build relationships in the face of rising bilateral tensions.

item.title: South Korea’s ex-defense minister attempts suicide; police raid presidential office
item.description: The fallout from South Korea's brief martial law continues amid reports of raids on the president's office and an attempted suicide by the ex-defense minister.

item.title: Oracle shares suffer steepest drop of 2024 after earnings miss
item.description: Oracle shares fell on Tuesday following disappointing quarterly results from the database software company.

item.title: The CPI report Wednesday is expected to show that progress on inflation has hit a wall
item.description: The consumer price index is expected to show a 2.7% 12-month inflation rate for November.

item.title: Trump promises 'fully expedited' permits for investors of $1 billion-plus in U.S.
item.description: The Truth Social post signals Trump's aim to deregulate federal agencies, undo Biden-era environmental rules, and attract foreign investment.

item.title: Surprise RBI governor pick could pave the way for India rate cut as soon as February, economists say
item.description: India has appointed a new central bank governor in a surprising move that some experts say strengthens outlook for rate cuts early next year.

item.title: Adidas' German headquarters raided in connection with tax investigation
item.description: Adidas' German headquarters was raided as authorities investigate a yearslong tax concern.

item.title: Google claims quantum computing milestone — but the tech can't solve real-world problems yet
item.description: While Google's new chip called Willow has been noted for advancing the field of quantum computing, experts question the current real-world uses.

item.title: Travel is finally back — and an era of huge growth is upon us
item.description: U.N. Tourism says international arrivals will fully recover this month, marking an end to years of recovery efforts stemming from the Covid-19 pandemic.

item.title: Stellantis CEO Carlos Tavares lost control of the automaker with 'arrogant' mistakes, sources say
item.description: Sources told CNBC that Carlos Tavares was fixated on near-term costs and profits to the detriment of the business as well as the company's products.

item.title: 'White gold' seen as pivotal to Europe's massive trade deal with South America
item.description: Analysts at ING said the significance of critical raw materials like lithium seemed to be "making less headlines" in the coverage of the free trade agreement.

item.title: Dodge maker Stellantis and China's CATL team up to build $4.3 billion EV battery plant in Spain
item.description: Stellantis and CATL have announced plans to jointly build a 4.1 billion euro ($4.3 billion) lithium iron phosphate battery plant in Spain.

item.title: Walgreens shares pop on report pharmacy chain could sell itself to PE firm Sycamore
item.description: Walgreens and Sycamore have been discussing a deal that could be completed early next year, The Wall Street Journal reported.

item.title: Is this London’s best kept cultural secret? A royal palace turned parking lot is reinventing itself — again
item.description: Somerset House is known for its ice rink and movie screenings — but hundreds of artists work there too. In 2025, it will mark 25 years as a cultural center.

item.title: China's November imports post surprise drop; sharpest decline in 14 months
item.description: Export has been a rare bright spot as the world's second largest economy contends with lackluster domestic consumption and a prolonged housing downturn.

item.title: 48-year-old turned down a VP job with a 25% raise, but only 10 days of PTO: ‘It sets a precedent for what the company values’
item.description: Sherri Carpineto declined a big job offer because of its limited PTO policy, which she says reflects the company's stance on flexibility and work-life balance.

item.title: Luigi Mangione charged with murder of UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson, court record shows
item.description: Luigi Mangione is being detained in Pennsylvania after being found with a gun consistent with the one used by kill UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson.

item.title: Nvidia shares fall after China opens investigation over possible violation of antimonopoly law
item.description: Nvidia shares were under pressure after a Chinese regulator said it was investigating the chipmaker over possible violations of the country's antimonopoly law.

item.title: From Trump and Turkey, to Russia and Iran — Syria's regime change has huge global consequences
item.description: The dramatic collapse of Bashar al-Assad's Syrian regime at the hands of rebel forces this weekend will have deep ramifications across the globe.

item.title: He bought a KFC store in Australia for $100,000 in 1969. Today, his fast food company is worth over $3 billion
item.description: Jack Cowin, founder and chairman of Competitive Foods Australia, shares his "biggest break" in life, which ultimately made him a billionaire.

item.title: U.S. can become a crypto superpower with 'sensible' regulation, Eric Trump says
item.description: Speaking to CNBC's Dan Murphy in Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates, Eric Trump said Monday that he'd been a "big fan of crypto for a long time."

item.title: Ant Group gets new CEO as billionaire founder Jack Ma talks up AI in rare appearance
item.description: Alibaba and Ant Group co-founder Jack Ma said the AI era over the next 20 years would "exceed everyone's imagination."

item.title: Oracle shares slide on earnings and revenue miss, disappointing forecast
item.description: Oracle shares fell Tuesday morning after the database software company issued disappointing quarterly results.

item.title: Ex-Dodge, Ram boss Tim Kuniskis returning to Stellantis after CEO's exit
item.description: Well-known Stellantis executive Tim Kuniskis is returning to the automaker effective immediately, CNBC has learned.

item.title: UK business confidence falls to lowest level in almost two years after Labour budget
item.description: British businesses lost steam and pulled back on hiring last month, as industry reacted to the Labour government's bumper tax-raising budget, new data showed Monday.
